intro: Euploca uninervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined euploca, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with a single prominent vein. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbellate clusters, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. Euploca uninervis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on tropical flora and plant morphology.
